column3: Definition
column5: Example: based on the following synthetic dataset  https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/uciml/breast-cancer-wisconsin-data. Where there is not information, we added made up a value example for the sake of clarity of what it can be added per metadata descriptor (cells in green).

column3: A category denoting a rather broad domain or field of interest, of study, application, work, data, or technology. Topics have no clearly defined borders between each other.
A placeholder concept for visual navigation by dividing data formats by the content of the data that is represented.
The machine learning task the synthetic data was generated for.
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.
A planned process that produces output data from input data.
A standard alphanumeric code to uniquely identify scientific and other academic authors and contributors.

An identifier of the Dataset preferably a unique identifier such as Zenodo DOI. The URL where the synthetic data is archived (or the 'Record URL' value), can also be added here in case the dataset has not a unique identifier yet.
The name of the dataset, which need not necessarily uniquely identify it.
The description of the dataset
column5: Predict whether the cancer is benign or malignant
column13: description: "Predict whether the cancer is benign or malignant"

column3: The year in which a document was published

Taxonomy identifier curated by the NCBI Taxonomy (search for organism IDs here: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy; or use the OLS: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ncbitaxon). You can find further details at 'https://www.uniprot.org/help/taxonomic_identifier'.
An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to undergo sexual reproduction in order to differentiate the individuals or types involved.
A descriptor that defines a group by a range of the time quality inhering in each bearer of the group by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.
Statistical sample size is a count evaluating the number of individual experimental units

The role played by an entity part of study group as defined by an experimental design and realized in a data analysis and data interpretation such as patients, physical samples, tissue cultures, cell nuclei, blood samples, cells, temperature measurements
Number of sample's information carriers that can be measured, observed, or logged.
The main format in which data is structured and represented in an electronic file. It is normally defined by the file extension of the file (e.g. FASTQ for a '.fastq' file).
Unique identifier of the scientific article where the creation of the synthetic dataset is described such as PMID or DOI of the publication

Unique and persistent identifier of an external resource where the tool (its documentation or code) is hosted. It should be uniquely resolvable (e.g. either be a URI, or a Compact URI resolvable against identifiers.org).
Structured system of communication in which the dataset is defined
The general categories (e.g. Single Cell Sequencing) of the used assay instrument to generate the original data.
A descriptor that refers to the type of variables in a dataset indicating whether the variable is a mixture of different types, a numerical value, or a categorical label
Percentage of missing values in the entire dataset, i.e., total number of missing values divided by total number of values in the entire dataset (%)
column9: potential consideration if this could somehow fit to EDAM. Related to Imputation?/Extrapolation?

column3: The URL of the record or archive of the synthetic dataset
